pr_title: Docker pull with authenticated user OKAPI-912

timeline.message:
Docker pull with authenticated user OKAPI-912

Configuration property `dockerRegistries` includes list of registries
with authenticaition at the moment. Expected to be extended with
a specifier for other registry.
Registry can be specified as part of dockerRegistries

timeline.bodyText: https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.40/#section/Authentication allows "identitytoken", we should also support this.
timeline.author: julianladisch
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2750,6 +2750,13 @@ there happens to be one, Okapi will remove it.  Note that it may end
 with a path like in `https://folio.example.com/okapi`.
 * `dockerUrl`: Tells the Okapi deployment where the Docker Daemon
 is. Defaults to `unix:///var/run/docker.sock`.
+* `dockerRegistries`: List of registries to use for Docker image pull. The
+value is a JSON array of of objects where each object may have the following properties
+`username`, `password`, `email`, `serveraddress` and `registry`. The first 4 properties
+are passed as autentication to the Docker registry - refer to
+[Docker Authenticaton](https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.40/#section/Authentication).

replies.bodyText: I don't think so. This is returned by auth which is not used by Okapi. How long is that valid?
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

replies.bodyText: Added, if somebody finds it useful :-)
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.bodyText: Can you add an example that also shows how we support unauthenticated pulls?
timeline.author: julianladisch
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2750,6 +2750,13 @@ there happens to be one, Okapi will remove it.  Note that it may end
 with a path like in `https://folio.example.com/okapi`.
 * `dockerUrl`: Tells the Okapi deployment where the Docker Daemon
 is. Defaults to `unix:///var/run/docker.sock`.
+* `dockerRegistries`: List of registries to use for Docker image pull. The
+value is a JSON array of of objects where each object may have the following properties
+`username`, `password`, `email`, `serveraddress` and `registry`. The first 4 properties
+are passed as autentication to the Docker registry - refer to
+[Docker Authenticaton](https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.40/#section/Authentication).

replies.bodyText: That would be an empty object as one of the element for dockerRegistries .. is that the example you want? (And also the existing behavior of Okapi, when no dockerRegistries is defined).
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText:
Can you also add a test with an empty JsonObject for unauthenticated pull?
conf.put("dockerRegistries", new JsonArray()
        .add(new JsonObject())
        .add(new JsonObject().put("username", "x").put("password", "y")));
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: I still cannot find such a test that should succeed.
replies.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: I still don't see it, can you point me to the line?
replies.author: julianladisch

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:folio-org/okapi into OKAPI-912-docker-pull-with-auth

timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText:
The host value was "localhost:5000" before the last commit.
If we always use "localhost" this parameter can be removed and it can be hardcoded in pullImage.
How can we unit test that the "registry" parameter is handled correctly?
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: There's one localhost:5000 and localhost:5000/ now.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

replies.bodyText: Yes. That "localhost" is the containerHost.. something completely different. And that can be hard-coded.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.message:
Registry testing and containerHost is always "localhost"

Registry tested in two ways.. Against local mock to see we see the correct
host+port. Also testing against real Docker instance (if available) and
see that it indeed uses the registry we provide.
